description:
Imagine a future where you’re developing cloud-based platform solutions that enable the use of data across disciplines and business areas
Join us in this role where you’ll get the opportunity to architect and build end-to-end data engineering solutions that provide the foundation for an enterprise platform for cloud-based analytics across the company. You’ll be a part of the Agile Release Trains (ARTs) and will therefore work closely with product owners, subject matter experts, and business stakeholders. You’ll be advising the business on how to enable data in order to increase business value
Welcome to Architecture, Data & Technology
You’ll be part of Data & Advanced Analytics (DAA) team, which includes professionals that are passionate about data, data applications, and green energy. The DAA team is one of five teams in our Architecture, Data & Technology department. The team consists of 25 professionals within the areas of data management, data engineering, and data science. We’re committed to delivering on our company’s digital strategy and creating a strong platform for analytics, model management, machine learning, etc. – all built on cloud technologies
You’ll play an important role in:

designing and building data pipelines for modern cloud-based analytics across the company
working with big data, complex and large datasets to be presented in a structured way to the business consumers
ensuring that data format and storage options are the best fit for end-user needs
optimising data pipelines security, stability, and performance and maintaining and monitoring existing ØDL data pipelines
helping Data Scientists with data flows for their models and applications to ensure efficient execution
running PoCs to select and maintain relevant data engineering tools.

To succeed in the role, you:

have deep experience in stream processing, e.g. Spark, Flink, Kafka Streams, and Kinesis Analytics
are proficient in Scala, Java, and/or Python as well as SQL, KSQL, and Kafka
have a passion for developing software to address data processing challenges
have experience monitoring and orchestrating data pipelines as well as with quantitative analyses and processing large data volumes
have experience with popular cloud platforms and container technology tools and with installation and maintenance of Linux and Linux-based applications
preferably have experience working with Spark/PySpark, NiFi, Agile, Scrum or SAFe®.

Join a world leader in green energy
Ørsted is a global leader in offshore wind energy and ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company. To be a frontrunner, we invest significantly in employee development and from the moment you join us, we’ll support your personal and professional growth. Here, you’ll get the opportunities that will unleash your full potential, and you’ll experience a collaborative, diverse, and dynamic work environment.
Shape the future with us
Send your application no later than 22 January 2021. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis.
Don’t hesitate to contact Tristan El Jed, Data & Advanced Analytics Team Lead in ADT GDC, at recruitement_MY@orsted.dk if you’d like to know more about the position
You should expect some travelling in relation to your work.

About the job

Application deadline: 22.01.2021

Country: Malaysia

Workplace: Kuala Lumpur

Working hours: Full-time

About Ørsted

6,500 employees worldwide.
Headquartered in Denmark and operating in seven countries.
Ørsted develops, constructs and operates offshore and onshore wind farms, solar farms, energy storage facilities, and bioenergy plants, and provides energy products to its customers.
Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.

An inclusive team

Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation or beliefs. We’re committed to secure an inclusive work environment characterised by a respect for all people so everyone feels free to openly share their input and ideas.

What we offer

100% paid monthly premium costs for health and dental.

30 days of paid holiday (plus bank holidays).

An innovative environment that encourages diverse perspectives.

Competitive base salary.
title: Senior Data Engineer (Streaming Data)

description:
Country

Malaysia

Job Family

Operations

For over 80 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world’s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer’s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of ~9,000 employees.

Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future: Currently we are in the latter stages of a transformational journey from a traditional market research company to a trusted provider of prescriptive data analytics powered by innovative technology. This is only possible with extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!

Job Description

Quality

1. Provide timely and accurate feedback to the Operation Manager on

the major performance areas of the Field team including

collection status, retailer complaints, recruitment status,

operational issues, data, panel and other day-to-day issues

2. Maintain positive working relationships and open communication

with all colleagues, including the Field team, Account Managers,

other departments and in the Region

3. Continually innovate, develop and suggest enhancements to gain

better work efficiency

4. Continually ensure that the company’s regional and global

standards are adhered to all times

5. Provide timely and reliable updates to the Operation Manager and

other colleagues for possible market development changes

including: new products or new product categories, channels,

retailer profiles, brand activities, trends and other relevant

information.

6. Fully responsible to ensure full understanding of all GfK tools &

software used

7. Ensure full knowledge of GfK retail audit methodologies and

definitions, fully understand and apply the data control

procedures and techniques, as documented by the GfK Asia

Research department, ensure consistent data output and

thoroughly understand the product manual.

8. Ensure full knowledge of all field processes as documented in

the Field Manual.

9. Fully responsible for all assigned tasks delegated by the Operation

Manager (including ad-hoc studies, trade survey studies,

universe checks etc)

10. Successfully support and execute New PGs launch. Able to Supervise, role out QC and Cost Control on Operation Project

Control and Planning

1. Fully responsible for product data quality.

2. Fully responsible for accurate data entry and coding.

3. Fully responsible to ensure correct audit sheets are sent to the

retailers monthly.

4. Ensure full knowledge of the Company’s quality standards are

achieved for sample targets, sample stability, retailers

satisfaction, data entry deadlines, data control procedures and

feature quality.

5. Ensure all relevant work manuals are utilised and kept up to

date.

6. Ensure successful recruitment and retention of retailers in line

with the objectives set by the Operation Manager.

7. Responsible for ensuring optional data quality by conducting

regular quality analysis

8. Responsible for highlighting coding errors to the Operation

Manager to enable corrections to be made to maintain high level

of data accuracy.

9. Responsible to resolve and check any quality issues raised by

clients and Client Service personnel.

10. Ensure the timely submission of monthly market reports per

agreed schedule outlined by the Operation Manager.

11. Maintaining, improving and managing current job scope with high degree of participation and ownership.

12. High planning and organization skills in order to comply with deadlines, knowledge in selecting the correct profile and identifying wrong/false information.

13. Like managing fast pace information,enjoy fast pace & challenging works, able to handle pressing deadline and multi tasking.

Retailer Servicing

1. Establish, develop and maintain positive working relationships

with retailer contacts at all levels at all times.

2. Ensure the appropriate level of service and support is provided

to maximise retailer retention.

3. Continually innovate, develop and enhance the services that

retailers receive, both short and long term.

4. Ensure retailers receive regular presentations by working closely

with the respective product portfolio Account Managers

personnel and co-ordinating preparation of presentation

materials with team members

5. Document all requests and comments made by retailers and

report to the Field Manager to ensure timely feedback and

follow-up actions to resolve any issues.

6. Excellent sales/negotiation skills required for shop recruitment.

7. Sound analytical skills and the ability to interpret research data

8. Ability to grasp and quickly understand markets, methodologies and techniques.

9. Split of 90% Desk-bound job and 10% fieldworks going out in market visiting retailers/project

Sales and Marketing

1. Responsible for creating awareness and raising the company

profile to all retailers by means of direct marketing, media

awareness, servicing etc.

2. Identify new business opportunities by highlighting emerging

markets in the retail industry.

Market Knowledge

1. Maintain up to date market knowledge on all product categories

audited by undertaking regular market visits, at least once a

week, to keep abreast of the current and future market offerings,

and regularly performing model comparisons to build a high level

of product knowledge.

2. Keep up to date on changes in the universe by product category

by regular market observation checks, desk research etc.

3. Understand the channel definition, track existing channels and

monitor the development of new channels.

4. Inform the Field Manager on distribution changes in the country

in order to guarantee continuous tracking of all major distribution

channels.

5. Become the company expert on the specified product categories

and its features.

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!
title: Senior Field Executive

description:
Key responsibilities:

Application Specialist plays multiple roles, with each role having specific responsibilities.

Service Delivery Expert

Responsible for providing reliable delivery of IT services based on IT Service Management (ITSM) processes. The responsibilities include:
Provide expertise to change management according to ITSM.
Ensure operational stability and effectiveness of IT systems through appropriate application management, monitoring and support.
Provide configuration, adaptation, scripting and testing expertise to maintain and enhance solutions according to business needs.
Contribute to knowledge management and ensure quality of knowledge, including solution documentation and knowledge base.
Maintain GxP systems in validated state, according to Computer Systems Validation (CSV) policy and procedures.
Responsible in multiple phases in the solution lifecycle, starting with relevant stages in the Implementation phase, and heavily in Operation and Maintenance, and Retirement phases.
Collaborate with delivery partners and facilitate cross-functional experts to deliver a particular service where required.
Contribute to continual improvement initiatives.
Strive to deliver IT services with agile mindset - stability, flexibility, speed

Domain Expert

Maintain a good understanding of business processes and context in which the IT services are consumed within the PT space, such as manufacturing, quality, supply chain and engineering.
Apply knowledge of systems, tools and problem-solving skills in the respective domain.
Continual self-development to maintain up-to-date knowledge of the industry and domain of specialization.

Technical Expert

Maintain good working knowledge of products, both commercial off-the-shelf and proprietary solutions used in the respective domains. These include data historian, Manufacturing Execution System (MES) and system and equipment interfaces.
Good knowledge of Windows Server, JBoss and SQL. Experience in installation and configuration for applications in Windows Server.
Maintain a good understanding of industry reference architecture and terminology.
Apply hands-on skills in the underlying technologies required to operate, maintain and enhance the solutions.
Depth of subject matter expertise, complexity of solution landscape, mission-criticality and service levels of solutions, service delivery model and stakeholder landscape vary according to the seniority level.

Key Competencies

Passionate about learning, sharing and further developing “best practice” and embed it as “next practice” to achieve greater impact
Good enough instead of perfection
Exhibits servant leadership behaviour, self-aware leader and a flexible team-player in a multi-cultural environment
Agile competencies: having a growth mindset, knowing yourself, being courageous and get connected

Mandatory Skills

Experience in one or more domains: manufacturing, quality, supply chain, engineering, preferably in life sciences industry
Working knowledge of Computer Systems Validation (CSV) and GxP
ITIL V3/V4, certification is an advantage
Possess a combination of analytical thinking, hands-on problem solving, and a customer-service mindset
Expert hands-on experience in one or more of the following: Windows Server, JBoss, SQL, data historian, MES and equipment interfaces.
Stakeholder management
Communication skills
Life sciences industry and commercial process, solution, application and system knowledge preferred

Academic Requirement

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related study (or equivalent project-related experience).

Years of Relevant Working Experience

A minimum of 5 years of experience in IT
3 years of relevant experience as an application specialist.

Contract length: 6 months

Application Deadline: 15/01/2021

Expected Start Date: 01/02/2021

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Benefits:

Free parking
Health insurance

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Education:

Bachelor's (Required)

Location:

Kuala Lumpur (Required)

Work Remotely:

No
title: Application Specialist (Technical SME)

description:
Our vision is to become the Skyscanner for online shopping, the place for South East Asia’s 600M people start their e-commerce journey. The place where consumers discover the latest trends, compare prices and get the best deal. With more than 3 billion offers on our platform; 30+ million monthly shoppers; and, a reputation as an independent authority when it comes to insights about the regional e-commerce sector, iPrice is at the centre of South East Asia’s e-commerce revolution.

Why join us?

Surround yourself with people who are ambitious, passionate, dynamic and constantly looking for ways to improve themselves. Join us and help us drive iPrice’s continued success, our monthly double-digit growth, and be a part of a diverse environment which combines the talent and insights of the 7 countries we that are operating in!

Organization backed by world class investors like Naver, Line, Gobi and 500 Start-ups
Management team comprised of international managers with experience from world-class organizations
Performance focused culture championing ownership, transparency and open communication
Diverse colleagues (25 nationalities and counting)
Coaching and world-class trainings with access to key experts in your field

RESPONSIBILITY:

Ensure all services are at a high quality of health, reliability, availability and security, within our Service Level Objectives.
Define the blueprint for our architecture that easily allows daily deployments of any workload, consistently from development all the way to production.
Provide architectural input for system design to improve scalability, reliability and availability.
Set the budgets, plan ahead of required system capacity and drive infrastructure cost efficiency.
Own the relationships across all our cloud infrastructure providers and ensure the teams are working within the given constraints.
Set and drive the strategic direction and OKRs of our infrastructure partners and technologies.
Collaborate with engineering teams on their infrastructure needs, and advise them throughout the development lifecycle.
Drive process for incident management.
Create easy-to-understand Service Level Objectives.
Lead the team to design, develop and manage monitoring tools to provide performance dashboards, alerts, and collect data required to proactively identify issues and/or recommend improvements.
Advocate and promote knowledge sharing and the “DevOps culture” across the engineering functions.
Coach, lead, develop your people to create a passionate can-do culture.

Requirements

A Bachelor's Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related subject.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in managing infrastructure teams, preferably in start-ups.
Strong familiarity with deployment automation/configuration management tools like Chef, Ansible, Puppet, or Terraform.
Possess solid experience with AWS cloud services. Experience in GCP or Azure is a plus.
Have extensive experience building scalable platforms leveraging containers in a production environment.
Operated distributed data storage systems at scale, especially Elasticsearch and SQL Azure.
Operated big data processing and workflow tools such as Spark, Airflow.
Have experience with logging and telemetry services.
Solid knowledge of continuous integration, continuous delivery, automated testing and all phases of the software development lifecycle.
Experience of working in an agile and multi-cultural environment across many SCRUM teams at the same time.
A Kaizen mindset and spirit of continuous improvement on a personal level and always up to date with the latest technology trends professionally.
Expertise in designing, analysing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with effective communication skills and a sense of drive.
Highly organized and capable of providing appropriate technical leadership while requiring minimal day-to-day guidance.

Benefits

Comprehensive healthcare including outpatient/in-patient benefits for you and your family
Work permit / visa coverage for expatriates to work in Malaysia
Extra perks including claimable grab rides if you’re in the office past 7 pm; stocked pantry; subsidised vending machine/ snacks and plenty of iPrice events
title: Director / Senior Manager, Infrastructure (Cloud)

description:
Beam is Asia-Pacific’s largest and fastest-growing shared micromobility company led by technology and innovation. We’re on a mission to turn little drives into better rides and make cities flow better for everyone. Shared micromobility is one of the fastest-growing industries globally, and we are leading the way in Asia-Pacific, with fast-growing operations in Australia, New Zealand, South Korea, Taiwan and Malaysia, with many new city launches underway.
Our engineering team builds cutting-edge technology and is uniquely challenged by real-time processing of large-scale, fast-paced vehicle data, integrating internet-connected vehicles in the biggest application of Internet of Things to-date and supporting the technology needs of multiple stakeholders such as riders, governments and operations, which runs a proprietary, complex and rapidly-evolving system for vehicle maintenance and charging at high cost-efficiency.
Beam has a strong culture of engineering excellence where engineers pride themselves in collaborating + sharing knowledge, learning continuously, innovating to deliver high impact solutions, improving efficiencies and writing clean, reliable and scalable code.
As a Fullstack Engineer you will work on an independent product delivery team alongside other engineers, designers, and product managers to deliver high-impact solutions focused around one of Beam’s core problems focuses such as operational efficiency.

Responsibilities

Develop complex software systems scaling to millions of users with production quality deployment, monitoring, and reliability.
Develop across the full-stack (backend, mobile, UI/UX, operations)
Work closely with various business partners including product, design, government relations, business development, strategy and operations to solve high impact problems.
Writing functional and integration tests.
Sharp problem-solving skills and ability to resolve ambiguous requirements.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related STEM field is preferred.
4+ years expertise in one or more object-oriented design methodology and large-scale application development (e.g. Kotlin, Ruby, Python, Go, Java, C++).
Experience building user interfaces with HTML, CSS, and Javascript.
Excellent understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms.
Excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences.

Benefits:
Join us to be part of the urban mobility and sustainable transportation revolution! We are a startup in every sense of the word. Expect autonomy, visibility, breakneck pace, cutting-edge technology, barriers to overcome, problems to solve. If you are one to lead the charge, smash through barriers and create positive impact, we want to talk to you!

At Beam, we offer:

Opportunity to make an impact by being part of a movement that will revolutionise transportation in cities
Be part of an organisation in hyper-growth mode with plenty of opportunity for personal development
Flexible and inspiring workplace with a team of competent, motivated and fun co-workers
Autonomy and ownership of the work you do, with flexible hours and even unlimited days off
Your choice of a MacBook or Windows laptop
Comprehensive remuneration package and benefits

The Beam Group of Companies is an equal employment opportunity employer, dedicated to providing an inclusive, open and diverse work environment. All are welcome regardless of race, language, religion, gender, nationality, age, disability or other divisive categorisations.
By submitting an application, you acknowledge that you have read the Privacy Policy and that you consent to Beam processing data in accordance with the Privacy Policy. Please let us know if you change your mind at any time in relation to Beam processing your personal data.

title: Project Officer
Data Support Engineer (Oracle PeopleSoft Database)

description:
About Us

NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives.

Kopitiam, a household name in the F&B sector is the latest addition to our family of NTUC Social Enterprises.

Job Description

Utilize historical data sets and business plans to model and forecast business trends

Develop models, dashboards and detailed reports to help internal customers quickly and accurately grasp business and operational trends

Liaise with stakeholders to identify business needs and requirements, translating them into functional requirements

Track and report metrics of organizational initiatives

Partner with data engineers and other stakeholders to improve data quality and timeliness

Undertake research to identify and recommend optimal solutions to complex challenges

Examine and evaluate business practices and systems, and proffer suggestions aimed at increasing efficiency and productivity, while maintaining or increasing compliance rates

Participate in projects in the digital transformation journey, where required.

Work in collaboration with the centralised Advanced Analytics team

Qualifications

Diploma / Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Applied Mathematics, Business, or related disciplines(Fresh graduates are welcome to apply as trainees)

Proficiency in query and data manipulation languages such as SQL, Python

Familiarity with GSuite and business intelligence tools such as Google Data Studio or Tableau

Good presentation,communication, and visualisation skills

Highly numerate with the ability to map business problems to data and data to business opportunities

Is a self-starter and able to work in a fast-paced environment against tight timelines with a team mindset

Prior experience working in F&B or Retail sector will be an advantage

Experience with Google Cloud Platform and in particular BigQuery is a plus

Other Information

As Junior Analyst, you will assist business managers to collect, analyze and interpret data from internal and external sources to generate relevant analysis for decision making and supporting business objectives.

Interested applicants can email full resume to :

yeelin_sam@ntucenterprise.sg

description:
ZALORA Engineering is looking for software engineers to work on the backend services that power the mobile apps.

Join us in building our high traffic site serving millions of customers per month throughout Southeast Asia. You will be exposed to a polyglot architecture, modern development workflows, and a forward-thinking team dedicated to solving the big-picture problems in e-commerce.

As a member of the mobile backend team, you will hack on the mobile API and a portfolio of microservices to provide the functionality that our customers enjoy.

This position is based in Malaysia or considered to open for remote working due to the current travel restriction.?

Build high performance, well-structured backend services.
Research cutting edge technologies and techniques to improve application reliability, developer experience and raw performance.

title: Software Engineer (VB.Net)

description:
Our vision is to become the Skyscanner for online shopping, the place for South East Asia’s 600M people start their e-commerce journey. The place where consumers discover the latest trends, compare prices and get the best deal. With more than 3 billion offers on our platform; 30+ million monthly shoppers; and, a reputation as an independent authority when it comes to insights about the regional e-commerce sector, iPrice is at the centre of South East Asia’s e-commerce revolution.

Why join us?

Surround yourself with people who are ambitious, passionate, dynamic and constantly looking for ways to improve themselves. Join us and help us drive iPrice’s continued success, our monthly double-digit growth, and be a part of a diverse environment which combines the talent and insights of the 7 countries we that are operating in!

Organization backed by world class investors like Naver, Line, Gobi and 500 Start-ups
Management team comprised of international managers with experience from world-class organizations
Performance focused culture championing ownership, transparency and open communication
Diverse colleagues (25 nationalities and counting)
Coaching and world-class trainings with access to key experts in your field

iPrice connects customers and online merchants. Our business relies on our ability to assist online merchants, service providers, and traditional brands to grow their online customer base. As a Senior Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will be a member of our Categorization, Integration, and Account Management team. Within iPrice, this cross-functional team leads our efforts in developing and managing long-term, win-win relationship with our partners. This includes overseeing the commercial relationship with our clients and ensuring technical integration of our systems. As a TAM, you will focus on developing innovative technical integrations and ensuring their smooth operations.

We are looking for a highly motivated, genuinely passionate individual who will support the development of our team. The team will expect you to build expertise around several in-house and external systems and stay alert to industry trends. Overall, you will act as a guide to lead the team to the next level of success.

On a day-to-day basis, you will support the organization and execution of tickets through our two-week sprints. Over the longer term, you will help coordinate and drive progress towards our ambitious, termly (4 months) OKRs. You will also seek out new solutions, coordinate with external partners, and find experts to improve our day to day operations.

Beyond the Categorization, Integration, and Account Management team, you will be part of our leads group where you will help define the business and organizational strategy for the company. You will have the opportunity to learn from a superstar, internationally sourced management team, combining experience from BCG, Microsoft, McKinsey, Google and other world-class organizations.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Establish productive technical relationships with product development teams in the largest e-Commerce companies across the SEA region

Take ownership and responsibility to ensure a business-critical projects are completed from technical standpoint
Drive the integration initiatives with iPrice partners and merchants
Act as a liaison between internal and external technical development teams
Propose solutions and improvements using a data-driven approach and drive their prioritization/technical implementation to achieve business objectives

Become a subject-matter expert for various internal and external systems (product feed processing, digital ad attribution models, transaction tracking systems)

Become a point of reference for domain knowledge when it comes to technical aspects of the designated accounts•

description:
Programme Summary

In conjunction with Workforce Singapore, NTU offer traineeships to support the SGUnited Traineeships Programme. The Traineeships are part of NTU's efforts to create relevant and meaningful traineeship opportunities for our nation’s new graduates entering the workforce during this difficult time.

About th e Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Centre

Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) and Alibaba Group officially launched the Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute (JRI) in February 2018. This is Alibaba’s first research institute on AI outside China. The joint research institute seeks to combine NTU’s human-centred AI technology which has been applied to areas such as health, ageing, homes and communities, with Alibaba’s leading technologies including Natural Language Processing (NLP), computer vision, machine learning and cloud computing to explore further technology breakthroughs and real-life AI solutions.

Over the next five years, the JRI will push the frontiers of AI to change the current technology-centric philosophy of AI research into one which is human-centric. The goal is make AI to become more effective, accessible and inclusive so that it can address future societal needs in ageless aging, new lifestyles and human-centered mobility. These AI and cloud technologies will be developed and tested on the NTU Smart Campus to demonstrate the effectiveness of the solutions before taking them to the market in Singapore and rest of the world. The program dovetails with Singapore’s ambition to train AI and data-science talent to support the country’s “Smart Nation” vision and its transformation to “Industry 4.0”. The JRI are led by researchers from NTU-UBC Research Centre of Excellence in Active Living for the Elderly (LILY) and the School of Computer Science and Engineering.

Job Descriptions:

Analyze, design, and develop a big data analytics platform
Test software development methodology
Provide ongoing maintenance, support, and enhancement in existing systems and platforms
Collaborate with data scientists, business users, project managers, and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions
Provide recommendations for continuous improvement
Collaborate with other engineers in the team to elevate technology and consistently apply best practices

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, information systems or other related disciplines
Strong programming skills on python, html, php, js, Unity3D and SQL
Prior experience with web/mobile application development
Prior experience with recommendation, crowdsourcing algorithms and systems

description:
Programme Summary

In conjunction with Workforce Singapore, NTU offer traineeships to support the SGUnited Traineeships Programme. The Traineeships are part of NTU's efforts to create relevant and meaningful traineeship opportunities for our nation’s new graduates entering the workforce during this difficult time.

About the Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering (SCELSE)

The Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering (SCELSE) is a unique interdisciplinary Research Centre of Excellence (RCE), funded by National Research Foundation, Singapore Ministry of Education, Nanyang Technological University and National University of Singapore. Hosted by NTU in partnership with NUS, SCELSE is linking new insights from the life sciences with expertise from the emerging technologies in engineering and natural sciences to understand, harness and control microbial biofilm communities.

Job Descriptions:

Providing bioinformatics analysis of next-generation sequencing data for various environmental genomics projects
Assisting researchers and principal investigators in processing and transforming next-generation sequencing data
Developing bioinformatics analysis methods and pipelines to solve novel data processing problems
Providing quality check and housekeeping of research data in the data management system

Requirements:

BSc degree in bioinformatics, computational biology, genetics, statistics, or relevant work experience
Strong programming skills in either Python, Perl, C++ or similar
Experience in DNA sequencing data analysis, ideally including exposure to primary data in one or more of genome projects, e.g. environmental genomics, population genetics, etc.
Familiarity with the ecosystem of standard tools for sequence analysis (e.g. BWA, Bowtie, Tophat, Cufflinks, IGV, FastQC, MEGAN)
Experience working in a Linux environment
Experience using statistical toolbox such as R or Matlab is a plus
Experience working in an HPC environment is a plus
Experience in machine learning and data mining is a plus

description:
The Site Manager serves as the central point of contact for all data center technical service and support. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to; service requests from Service Delivery, Service support liaison for clients as well as internal systems and networks, data center security as well as shipping & receiving.
In addition, the Site Manager provides day-to-day oversight and leadership of operated data center facilities. Responsibilities include vendor management of various vendors and suppliers, oversight of maintenance, repair, installation and operation of the facility performed by the data center facilities team provider as it pertains to electrical systems, mechanical systems, capacity planning, project management, customer build-outs, and all other aspects of data center facility operation. The Site Manager is responsible for managing the daily activities of the data center support team while working in collaboration with the Regional Engineering team, the Central Engineering team and various other internal and external customers.

.Essential duties:

Provide leadership to the local data center support team with a broad set of responsibilities; manage tactical and strategic activities with focusing on continuous improvement.

Responsible for timely execution of data center services such as remote hands, customer installs, and service requests.

Provides 24 x 7 on-call emergency response & support as necessary for incident management and data center emergency response to maintain the highest level of integrity and availability to data center.
Manage vendors and contractors to obtain maximum effectiveness and efficiency (safety, cost, equipment longevity, and reliability) and to maintain Mechanical & Electrical infrastructure per manufacturers' recommendation and corporate specifications.
Operates and maintains data center to assure 100% uptime to customers.
Ensures that data centers comply with all local, state, and federal health and safety requirements.
Ensures consistent risk management, change management, monitoring, and incident response in the data center
Development and management of data center budget for maintenance, repairs, capital and general operating costs; bottom-up development of yearly budgets. Negotiation and approval of vendor contracts/agreements
Works with Sales, Service Delivery and Customers to provide successful build implementations within specified timelines.
Participates in all Change Management processes including risk assessment and procedural development and review.
Works closely with the Global Central Engineering team in problem resolution and trending.

Manages raised-floor capacity, power and cooling in data centers, maximizing revenue space for installed products.

Manage projects and administration of professional consultants and contractors providing building repair, and capital improvement services.
Responsibility and oversight for customer implementations, including review and approval of proposed Service Level Agreements and Contract changes.
Ensure policy and procedure is followed and that all audit requirements are being met on a daily basis. Areas of focus include; service delivery, service support, and physical security.
Act as the escalation point for internal and external client inquiries.
Responsible for development and implementation of day-to-day tasks related to service level tracking, customer satisfaction improvement, process improvement, perform data center tours and budgetary controls. Consistent with this focus the individual will track operational metrics to provide senior management oversight and control for both snapshot data and long-term trend analysis.
Works with regional and global operations management staff to leverage existing operational procedures and reference material to expedite implementation, standardize operational methodologies, and facilitate best practices in areas of common interest and business focus.
Accountable to maintain and evolve internal operational policy and procedural reference documents.
Operate as a member of the extended data center Operations team to deliver on key business initiatives
Managing facilities training program and overall staff development.
Responsible for site safety and environmental compliance.
Ensures compliance of the data center with various accreditations e.g. SSAE16, PCI DSS, ISO 270001, Uptime M&O. Support various audits in relation of these accreditations.

Required skills:

Strong management and leadership skills gained through 15+ years' experience managing people, process, and technology.
Minimum of 10 years of experience with Windows, Linux, Unix, storage and networking technologies
Working knowledge of data center critical systems, including: diesel generators, UPS systems, fuel systems, switchgear, power distribution equipment, chillers, computer room air handlers, fire detection/suppression and building monitoring systems.
Experience with Vendor Management for outsourcing contract.
Must have the ability to make solid business decisions in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Candidate must display confidence in client-facing situations.
Team player with excellent consultative and communications skills and the proven ability to work effectively with internal and external clients, vendors and consultants.

Education or Equivalent Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Engineering (Mechanical or Electrical) or equivalent experience.
15 years of data center support & facilities experience in mission critical environments with 5 years in a supervisory/management role.
Certifications such as ITIL, MCSE, CCNP, CCSA, CDCP, CDCE desirable.

Please send your resume in word format to tang.yvonne@gsp-asia.com

Traineeship Description

CapitaLand is one of Asia’s largest diversified real estate groups. CapitaLand believes in growing its business in a sustainable manner to create long-term value for its investors and improve the economic and social well-being of its communities. The Group’s sustainability efforts have been consistently recognised globally. The Trainee will report to CapitaLand’s Chief Sustainability Officer, and will be part of the team to make an important contribution to CapitaLand’s ambitious elevation of its international best-in-class Environment Social Governance (ESG) performance and leadership position.

Responsibilities

Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to develop and implement various initiatives on the “environment, health and safety” (EHS) pillar of sustainability (Subjects include cutting-edge climate change and carbon advice, low energy transition, water conservation, waste management and climate resilience.)
Assist to monitor and report on emerging global EHS trends and regulation directions to feed into CapitaLand’s strategies, including the product roadmaps, working alongside CapitaLand’s business and product development units to define future improvement plans
Assist to design strategy and action plan to implement the EHS pillar of CapitaLand’s sustainability strategy, maximise opportunities and minimise risks with a view to creating/improving economic value for the business
Assist to drive and engage with CapitaLand’s business units and corporate functions to ensure full implementation and integration of EHS, including internal education, training, disseminating knowledge, best practice and standards
Analyse and provide insight from data, measure performance and complete gap analysis against industry indices and best practice.
Participate in any other Sustainability projects as directed

Degree in Sustainability/ Environmental Science/ Environmental Management/ Environmental Engineering or relevant technical disciplines
Applicants with the relevant technical academic qualification without work experience may apply
Passionate in energy and sustainability topics, such as developing greenhouse gas (GHG) strategies and inventories, carbon emissions inventories, water and waste footprints, and other environmental inventories
Entrepreneurial interest in growing a strategic platform within an expanding company
Strong organizational and planning skills, demonstrated flexibility in approach and proactive can-do attitude
Self-motivated, independent and results oriented with an analytical mindset, as well as a team player

The Traineeship with the Company will end on 5 Aug 2021.

description:
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singaporeâ€™s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Project Description:
Job-seeking can be a particularly stressful and anxiety-inducing moment of life. With the wide range of options available in the market, job-seekers find it difficult to find the right job that fits their interests and skills. As a result, a substantial number of people do not manage to find jobs, while others take up jobs which they are not a best fit for. We are building a recommendation engine to deliver personalised job recommendations to users of MyCareersFuture (the Governmentâ€™s job matching portal for Singaporeans). This engine exploits user and clickstream data to learn the preferences and suitability of users for different jobs, and then proactively pushes job recommendations to users to increase their chance of success.

We are looking for motivated, self-driven data scientist interns to work with us regarding Natural Language Processing related projects.

Learning Outcomes:
1. Gain exposure and hands-on experience on a

dvanced data science methods (Text analytics, recommender models)

2. Develop understanding on Cloud infrastructure / services (AWS, Databricks)

3. Gain exposure and hands-on experience on Data science models in production systems (Data pipelines, APIs, etc.)

Pre-requisites:
1. Understanding of Machine Learning;

2. Hands-on experience of Python;

3. Strong desire to release ideas to production, welling to working with constraints and obstacles

Also includes providing SAS platform security management, SAS application and underlying infrastructure support and ensuring processes are aligned and complaint with internal policies as well as regulatory requirements.

ongoing operations

description:
Developer

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Sitecore delivers a digital experience platform that empowers the world’s smartest brands to build lifelong relationships with their customers. A highly decorated industry leader, Sitecore is the only company bringing together content, commerce, and data into one connected platform that delivers more than 500,000 digital experiences every day. Leading companies including American Express, ASOS, Carnival Cruise Lines, Kimberly-Clark, L’Oréal and Volvo Cars rely on Sitecore to provide more engaging, personalized experiences for their customers. Learn more at Sitecore.com

Our employees are our foundation. Sitecore is built upon a diverse group of passionate, innovative, and collaborative individuals located across four continents and over 20 countries. The Sitecore values of Foster Collaboration, Push Boundaries, Take Ownership, Cultivate Community, and Customers First are what drive and unite us across the globe. Learn more about the Sitecore values here: https://www.sitecore.com/company/our-values

Sitecore is experiencing spectacular growth all over the world. To build on Sitecore’s success and growth, we’re looking for a skilled Developer to work as part of our Cloud Operations Team.

Responsibilities:

Writing code according to the code style set up by the tools;
Analysing, designing and programming software enhancements and/or new products.
Writing code to create single-threaded, multi-threaded or user interface event driven applications, either stand-alone and those which access servers or services.
Executing in prioritized order according to the plan.
Documenting the software enhancements and/or the new products.
Highlighting RISK items and schedule impact to Lead Developer and DM.
Using source debuggers and visual development environments.
Understanding business requirements and designing tests to ensure that the requirements are met.
Has complete understanding of developing product.
Understanding how developing functionality affects the whole developing component (or module) behaviour.
Knowledge and adherence to the Agile/Scrum/SAFe work principles.
Participating in team meetings.
Attending regular meetings with stakeholders to align their work with the Quarterly MBO Goals. Work on achieving the Quarterly MBO Goals.
Provides external training / taking part as a presenter in external events.

Requirement:

General Skills:

Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent.
More than 3 years of work experience in software programming domain.
Over 3 years of experience in any object-oriented programming language.
Excellent experience in Microsoft/.NET stack technologies [C#, ASP.NET, SQL, Azure].
Frontend experience: Angular, Typescript, Angular unit testing tools.
Good experience in designing/consuming the web API and integration with external providers (WebApi, OAuth2, OpenID, Basic Authentication etc.).
Automation/Testing, good experience in Unit Test framework NUnit, xUnit, SpecFlow will help the team to move fast.

Desired Skills:

Strong knowledge of Sitecore Product.
Strong knowledge of the version control systems.
Good experience in Git.
ServiceNow experience

Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.
title: Developer

description:
Engineer, Back-End

Do you love working in a fast paced, vibrant, and energetic environment?

An exciting opportunity exists at Ezypay for a talented and enthusiastic Back-End Engineer.

Ezypay is a multi-award winning FinTech company established in 1996, specialising in the provision of subscription and recurring direct debit payments.

With offices in Australia, New Zealand and Malaysia, Ezypay has processed over $3 billion worth of subscription payments in 9 countries across the Asia Pacific region (Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia, Singapore, Philippines, Hong Kong, China, Taiwan and Thailand) and we’re continually expanding.

Over the last few years, we have put significant effort into our next generation cloud subscription billing platform. This is a core strategic focus, and we continue to actively develop and grow this platform.

The Role and Responsibilities

As a BackEnd Engineer, you’ll directly contribute to building Australia’s leading recurring payments and subscription billing API. We are looking for a dynamic engineer to assist us in achieving our growth targets and to ensure our product is optimised for our customers’ needs.

Some of the cool things you’ll be involved in include;

Producing technical specifications and technical documentations.

Assist in the planing, development, implementation and testing of software programs that are easy to maintain, modular, well documented, and resource efficient under indirect supervision by a Senior or Lead Engineer.
Perform operational procedures, including ongoing maintenance, on runtime systems, both manual and automated, in accordance with company standards.
Provide recommendations for continuous improvement.

A little on our Technical Environment

Here’s a high level on how we work:

Our next generation payments platform has been developed using Java/Spring Boot micro-service architecture.
Our infrastructure is hosted on AWS; using a mixture of Fargate containerization and EC2 servers.
Our systems are secure and highly available – we have implemented passive and active monitoring and incident escalation using a combination of Datadog, CloudWatch Logs and Metrics, Postman, and Pagerduty
Our operating system of choice is CentOS and the team is fanatical about security, monitoring, and patch management.
Our infrastructure is immutable and managed using IaC principles via Terraform
We leverage build automation using CircleCI, and we’re working toward continuous deployment across all environments

Requirements you’ll need to succeed………

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or relevant information technology industry experience.
Solid grasp of computer science fundamentals, specifically data structures and algorithms.
Good working experience with Java, or a similar third generation programming language.
Good understanding of internetworking concepts and protocols
Working knowledge of a modern software development lifecycle management methodology, such as SCRUM
Team player attitude with a willingness to lead when necessary

Just a few of the benefits….

Generous salary package with Incentive Component
Gym subsidies
Casual dress code
Flexible working environment (work from home)
Take a day off on your birthday
Delicious office snacks and Friday Breakfast supplied
Guidance and mentoring from leaders within the business
Dynamic, positive work environment

How to Apply

If this sounds like the perfect role for you, don’t wait, it’s easy to apply online.

To be considered for the position please click 'Apply Now' and upload a current resume and cover letter addressing how you’ll be able to succeed with us.

This could be the start of your rewarding career with Ezypay

In Response to Covid-19

All interviews are currently being held virtually. If you are invited to attend an interview, our Human Resources team will guide you through our interview process.
title: Engineer, Back-End

description:
Country

Malaysia

Job Family

Technology

For over 80 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world’s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer’s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of ~9,000 employees.

Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future: Currently we are in the latter stages of a transformational journey from a traditional market research company to a trusted provider of prescriptive data analytics powered by innovative technology. This is only possible with extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!

Job Description

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will have key accountabilities to:

Work with the architects and an Agile team to influence the overall system architecture and performance goals.
Ensure timely delivery of software projects while maintaining the quality.
Ensure high software quality by writing unit and integration tests in TDD approach.
Identify and address application and data issues that affect application integrity.
Fix any defects and performance problems discovered in testing.
Suggest initiatives (e.g. training) that improve working efficiency and quality.
Actively contributing in agile practices, such as estimating and planning.

Our people in our teams are the most important, so we are looking for individuals who:

5+ years of commercial software development experience with an open source Java stack or .NET Core
Knowledge of the Spring framework and ecosystem
Experience in web development using JavaScript (ReactJs, Angular + TypeScript)
REST, API design
No-SQL Databases such as Mongo DB and Search indexes such as Elasticsearch or Solr
Have automated testing experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines
Experience in unit testing and mocking frameworks (Junit, NUnit, JustMock, Mockito)
End-to-End testing using Selenium and Cucumber with Gherkin syntax
Good understanding of Design Pattern and object oriented design (SOLID principles, Dependency Injection, Factory pattern)
An open and collaborative mindset both within and outside your team
Good communicator, fluent in English and ability to clearly express oneself
Interest in helping other engineers become even better

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!

description:
What We're Looking For

Ahrefs is looking for Data Science Interns to join our Data Science team, to be based in our Singapore office. We will be giving preference to senior (closer to graduation) students. We are ready to accommodate for terms as short as 2-3 months and adjust working dates/ hours to your academic schedule.

If you are passionate about applying Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to real world problems, as well as making products of high impact, Ahrefs is the place for you.

Qualifications

Hands on experience with Search, Information Retrieval, and Natural Language Processing
Good knowledge of Python and SQL
Hands on experience with large datasets and distributed computing
Hands-on experience with (at least one) deep learning framework: TensorFlow, Pytorch, Theano
Strong verbal and writing communication skills

Who We Are

Ahrefs builds online SEO tools and creates free learning materials that help millions of website owners around the globe to get more traffic from search engines.

For over 10 years now, Ahrefs has been crawling the web, storing and processing petabytes of data and fine-tuning a simple, intuitive user interface. It's now widely regarded as both a must-have for top marketing professionals and a trusted friend to small business owners.

Ahrefs tools and features cover most essential SEO needs like competitor research, keyword research, site auditing, rank tracking and much, much more.

The company was founded in 2010 by Dmitry Gerasimenko and is headquartered in Singapore.

Contact

Please reach out to jobs@ahrefs.com with your CV, a brief note on what made you interested in this internship opportunity and your time constraints.

Singapore

description:
New product launches
Growth opportunities in the Oncology market
Highly innovative products

About Specialised Therapeutics

Specialised Therapeutics (ST) is an independent international biopharmaceutical company providing new specialist medicines and technologies to patients in Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia. As a company, we do this by partnering with global pharmaceutical companies, championing their products from pre-registration to full commercialisation in key regions. At ST, our primary objective is to enable people with unmet medical needs access to breakthrough, innovative therapies.

Culture

ST has carefully cultivated a work environment in which our employees are constantly challenged to do their best and think differently. Our company is determinedly inquisitive, perceptive and courageous, and nurtures these qualities by employing people who share our passionate interest in making a difference in patients’ lives. ST prides itself on a friendly, collaborative, open, dynamic and inclusive team, with a permanent focus on the why.

What we’re looking for

Having recently launched several new innovative oncology products in the south east Asian region, ST offers the exciting opportunity to be part of a growing company. We are currently looking to expand our SE Asia regional team and are seeking to appoint our first professional Clinical Accounts Manager with oncology experience to work across Malaysia and Brunei. This new role will be responsible for liaising with KOL’s and healthcare professionals to provide support in the attainment of knowledge and appropriate use of our novel cancer products through the development, maintenance, and enhancement of key customer relationships. In this role, you will be required to undertake detailed territory analysis and planning, in addition to utilising your effective communication skills to educate and support your customers.

Some of the key responsibilities include:

Map the scientific expertise: identify, complete and update Key Opinion Leaders (KOL) database in the disease area

of interest to STA.

Effectively communicate and educate KOLs on appropriate technical, therapeutic, disease state and product

information and successfully respond to queries from healthcare providers regarding the use of products in the STA portfolio across Malaysia and Brunei
Identify opportunities for collaboration with KOL, develop and enhance scientific and educational collaborations with

Healthcare Professionals (HCP)
Continuously develop and maintain a high level of technical, disease state, product and therapeutic area’s

knowledge through self-learning and active participation in training programs
Arrange and coordinate effective education workshops, seminars, webinars and programs
Communicate scientific information in a variety of settings, including but not limited to internal meetings, advisory

boards, individual discussions, hospital department meetings, continuous medical education (CME talks) in addition to one-on-one appointments

Regular travel within country, and occasionally to Singapore or Australia if required

Qualifications and Experience Requirements:

Registered pharmacist (preferable), Bachelor of Science minimum
Oncology sales or key accounts management experience
Previous working experience as oncology representatives for at least 3 year(s)
Clear understanding of Malaysia and Brunei healthcare system, regulatory processes, hospital listings and patient

care policies

Ability to interpret key scientific data and translate this information to meet educational and research needs
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Aptitude in networking and building relationships
Experience in sales and customer services will be an advantage
Excellent time and project management skills
Ability to prioritize and meet critical deadlines
Experience or knowledge of early access named patient process preferable
Knowledge of patient support program will be an added advantage
Experience working closely with distributors e.g Zuellig, DKSH etc

With exciting launch opportunities ahead, the successful applicant will need to possess drive, tenacity, integrity and be able to demonstrate a successful track record. It is essential the successful candidate has strong business acumen and clinical knowledge, can work in a collaborative and competitive environment whilst also working independently.

If you are looking for a position where you’ll have the freedom to take ownership of your role with a progressive and entrepreneurial business, then apply now.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

Work from home

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

Performance bonus

description:
Job Description

We are looking for a driven and enthusiastic Sales and Marketing Executive to help us with our aggressive expansion efforts in Indonesia. SAPELO LIFE SCIENCES is a boutique animal pharmaceutical research firm. We specialise in the discovery and the synthesis of research drugs for universities, research labs and clinics research uses. We are the top Southeast Asia distributor of animal pharmaceuticals specifically targeting the treatment for pets.

Given that for many people, their pets are an important part of their family, there is a large untapped market for animal pharmaceuticals. With the right talent in place, we’re looking to cement our reputation as the top company to provide our furry friends with the medications needed to live a long and happy life.

For this role, we’re looking for someone who will play an integral part of the development and execution of sales and marketing plans for the company. From brand awareness to product promotion, you will also work cross functionally with the sales team to achieve sales goals, complete post sales customer satisfaction surveys, and be the go-to person if our customers have any inquiries about our products.

You should be a competent professional, able to grasp consumer behaviour trends and generate creative ideas to better communicate our product value and service to our customers based in Philippines. The goal is to deliver effective marketing and sales initiatives that will build our brand and product awareness, and grow our sales steadily.

RESPONSIBILITIES

- Conducting market research to find answers about our consumer requirements, habits and trends.

- Brainstorming and developing ideas for creative marketing campaigns

- Assisting in outbound or inbound marketing activities by completing tasks including, but limited to content development, advertising optimisation, events planning.

- Liaise with external resellers, promoters, and distributors to run campaigns and increase sales.

- Collaborate with marketing and other professionals to coordinate brand awareness and marketing efforts.

- Plan and execute initiatives to reach the target audience through social media.

- Analyse marketing data (campaign results, conversion rates, traffic etc.) to drive better results in future marketing efforts.

- Complete individual tasks as assigned on a satisfactory level.

REQUIREMENTS:

* Hiring Filipino national who lives in Malaysia. We are able to offer a work visa for the right candidate.

* Good communications skills both verbal and written in Tagalog and English. Proficiency in Mandarin would be a plus.

* Able to work on a flexible schedule. Be ready to work on tasks 7 days away on rare occasions.

* Understand and execute directions from superiors well. Have independent ideas on improving the company overall operations.

* takes initiative and ownership of assigned duties.

* Social Media marketing strategy expert. Experience building social media pages, groups, and community.

* Previous experience working at a fast paced start-up a plus.

Pharmaceutical

description:
Our clients are faced with external pressures on an unprecedented scale. The ability to translate strategy into reality is key to their enhanced business performance. As an advisory professional, you will be focused on helping them achieve this goal.

You’ll work in high-performing teams that deliver exceptional client service, enabling organisations to grow, innovate, protect and optimise their business performance – playing your part in building a better working world.

We believe that you should own and shape your career. But we’ll provide the support and opportunities to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to succeed. The strength of our global network, combined with local empowerment and a relentless focus on winning in specific markets, means you’ll interact and team with individuals from various geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

The opportunity

Management and boards of directors rely heavily on internal audit to provide important proactive assessments and assurance around the effectiveness of controls and company processes, while also providing objective advisory support. As an internal audit professional, you will be leading engagements to identify control enhancements, operational and compliance process improvement and efficiency opportunities, as well as company-wide cost improvements. EY is a global leading service provider in this space, with a reputation for high quality and cost-effective innovative offerings.

As part of our internal controls team, you’ll focus on client opportunities where your expertise can make a substantial impact. You’ll apply your knowledge and experience to shape our services and motivate your team. You’ll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and working with senior mentors and talented colleagues.

Your key responsibilities

This is a role where no two days are the same – so you’ll find yourself taking on plenty of new responsibilities as you go. In a volatile world, effective risk management protects, sustains and improves business performance. As a risk professional, you’ll be focused on helping our clients develop an integrated and sustainable approach to risk and control that encompasses a holistic view of people, process and technology.

Skills and attributes for success

Executing Job planning: Conduct research on client background and risks and propose tailored audit work program and audit time schedules, coordinate with client on kick off meeting and other necessary planning activities.
Executing review: Perform testing of audit areas, communicate and discuss audit observations with client, and schedule closing meeting with client and prepare closing meeting deck.
Reporting: Prepare draft and final reports after the necessary internal reviews, wrap up audit work programs and workfiles, and assist in any other wrap up activities.
Developing and maintaining productive working relationships with client personnel
Building strong internal relationships within EY Consulting Services and with other services across the organization

To qualify for the role, you must

Have a degree in Accountancy, Business, Risk Management or related fields
Have a minor in any digital specialisation such as DA if applicable
Have strong computer skills such as Microsoft Office
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Able to work independently and as a team
Be able to travel

Ideally, you’ll also have

Proficiency with data analytic tools or digital skills such as ACL, Tableu, Alteryx, data science, Robotic Process Automation is a plus

Please note that for your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application:

Detailed resume
Highest academic certification and transcripts

Only applications with complete set of data and documents will be considered.

What we look for

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident leader equipped with strong people management skills and a genuine passion to make things happen in a dynamic organization.

What working at EY offers

EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:

Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

A bout us

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy, transaction and consulting services. The EY member firms in Singapore, with a strength of close to 3,400 people and 180 Partners, is part of the Asia-Pacific Area, which comprises 23 countries across 6 Regions and brings together over 55,000 people to provide services seamlessly across borders.

description:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to move your career path forward?

UPS is seeking a passionate, results-driven Manager to join our winning team in order to accelerate our International Sustainability Programme. Focused on Asia but also supporting work elsewhere. You will drive innovation and stakeholder engagement programmes in order to position UPS as the leading provider of sustainable logistics.

Position Summary:

UPS's Sustainability team drives the development and execution of the organisation's environmental and social sustainability strategy. We seek a Manager to join the team in support of this work. Reporting to the Vice President of International Sustainability based in London but working closely with the Vice President of Public Affairs for APAC in Singapore and the entire APAC management team. The manager will develop initiatives to position UPS as the leading provider of sustainable logistics solutions in APAC, as well as supporting the sustainability strategy elsewhere in International. This will include developing and implementing innovation and stakeholder engagement programmes by working cross functionally within UPS and also with external partners. This is a full-time position based in our APAC Region Office in Singapore.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Engage with APAC management team to develop APAC sustainability priorities for 2021 and beyond.
Work internally and cross-functionally in APAC to develop buy-in to the priorities.
Develop environmental and social innovation programmes in APAC to execute to the priorities, including working with Automotive and the Advanced Technology Group on new technology last mile solutions.
Develop stakeholder engagement programmes in APAC to execute to the priorities, including working with customers to develop partnerships and with employees to inspire them in our sustainability journey.
Provide APAC input into the annual Corporate Sustainability Report.
Represent the UPS brand by speaking at conferences and engaging in interviews in conjunction with Communications.
Support and provide cover for sustainability work elsewhere in International as needed.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or equivalent discipline is preferred.
Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience performing in a similar capacity.
Preferably from Transportation and Logistics industry. Open to any industry provided with Business experience.
A passion for sustainable development, both social and environmental, coupled with an understanding of the role of business in providing solutions.
Excellent networking and influence skills.
Very strong written and oral communications skills.
Highly numerate, comfortable handling data.
A solid grasp of the science of greenhouse gas and air quality emissions and an aptitude for the engineering and technology solutions required.
Willingness to travel, typically for one week but for up to 2 weeks, and to work occasional anti-social hours.
Fluent in English (verbal, written, presentation); Fluent in Mandarin highly preferred.

description:
About Nautilus.

Nautilus is building artificial intelligence to advance the efficiency of ocean commerce. We deliver technology to help shipping companies minimize fuel consumption, maximize operational efficiency, and optimize fleet performance. By arming ship owners and operators with real-time predictive decision support, Nautilus is reducing greenhouse gas emissions and making global trade sustainable.

Ocean shipping consumes over $100 billion dollars of fuel every year, and up to 30% of it can be saved. For owner-operators, reliance on manually collected and analyzed data makes it difficult to optimize fleet performance in real-time. By providing a unified data platform that leverages machine learning, Nautilus helps its clients make better decisions to maximize the return on each ship and every voyage. For our clients, this means they drive closer collaboration, greater transparency, and stronger accountability across their global teams every day.

About You.

Client Success owns the client relationship post-sales. The team's goal is to maximize client value with every interaction including pre-sales support, ship activation, onboarding/training users, uncovering valuable data insights, monitoring client health, and identifying upsell opportunities. The team consists of client Success Managers who work with a set of named accounts, deployment specialists who handle ship integrations, and industry specialists who use the tool to derive insights to help clients optimize their fleets. Together these teams are responsible for empowering our clients to become expert users and achieve amazing results.

We are looking for a data analyst who is highly analytical, personable, communicative and has a proven track record for delivering actionable insight. They will be working in a challenging and dynamic environment where their analysis will facilitate key business decisions and influence fleet movements around the world.

Outcomes For This Role.

Construct useful frameworks and analyze data from ship voyages, chartering contracts and existing performance models to derive strategic insights that will improve ship and fleet performance
Compile and analyze data from multiple internal and potentially external sources
Identify patterns and trends that can be communicated to the team and collaborate with the Data Analytics team to influence new performance models.
Develop strong Voyage Optimization expertise to provide daily inputs to clients
Work with the client Success Manager on an account to identify quantitative and compelling stories on the value delivered by the platform

Proficiencies.

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (eg. math, science, engineering, economics, etc.) 2+ years working in data mining, analysis, report building, data visualization and insights delivery
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to explain technical insights to technical and non-technical groups
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills with an ability to find drivers behind the data
Inquisitive to dive deep into data and models to investigate anomalies
Advanced proficiency in Excel and SQL
Experience working on python scripts would be a plus
Familiarity with APIs would be a plus
Ability to partner cross-functionally, across time zones and providing timely updates to internal stakeholders
Strong organizational skills, Works well under time pressure
Self motivated and resourceful, ready to learn new skills along the way
Shipping industry experience with strong preference for a background in a performance or operations role would be a plus

Our core values.

Get ready to join a group of diverse, smart, talented, and driven individuals. We are looking for people who are motivated by environmentalism and a future where shipping is sustainable and safe. A team member joining Nautilus is...

We’re THOUGHTFUL, with a bias towards action.
We’re an INCLUSIVE crew, and we are not passengers along for the ride.
We’re DIRECT and we ask the tough questions.
We EMPATHIZE with humanity.

Candidates must be located in and eligible to work in Singapore.

If you’re the right candidate, we want to hear from you. Please apply using the contact form below!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
