description:
CSIT develops products to advance the national security interests of Singapore. Our products are used in a wide range of operations, including but not limited to counter-terrorism and cyber network defence. We are looking for highly skilled software engineers to build mission-critical products that identify, analyse and disrupt threats.

Roles

As a software engineer in the Data Products team, you will operationalise, scale and serve a variety of aggregated, real-time and analytically-derived data to support Singapore's national security missions. You will be responsible for designing and developing performant, reliable and maintainable APIs while leveraging pragmatic unit, integration and performance testing. You will have the freedom to determine the best way to deliver value, be it developing from scratch or building upon the best solutions from the community.
Responsibilities

Influence the roadmap and development of data products to enhance existing capabilities or provide new opportunities
Design, develop, deploy and maintain high-quality code following engineering and testing best practices
Work with other software engineers and stakeholders to build solutions and gain novel insights to complex problems
Contribute to overall architecture and implementation of core infrastructural components (e.g. API gateway, messaging platform, auth services, etc.)

Requirements - Minimum Qualifications

We’re looking for someone who has:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Physics etc.) or equivalent practical experience
Software engineering experience in one or more general purpose programming languages
Knowledge of SQL and practical experience with RDBMS and NoSQL databases

Requirements - Nice-to-haves

Prior experience with Python web frameworks (e.g. Flask, FastAPI)
Prior experience building high-volume REST and gRPC web services
Understanding of domain driven design, microservice patterns and service-oriented architectures
Prior experience working with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark and Kafka

As CSIT is an agency under the Ministry of Defence (Singapore), only Singapore Citizens will be considered.
title: Software Engineer (Data Products)

description:
[CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]

Responsibilities

Align to, understand, and prioritize analytic goals to address business opportunities and value
Scope and build proof-of-concepts / prototypes using data science techniques directly
Conceive, develop, and test algorithms with tools like Python, R, etc. (Python is a must, R is good to have).
Carry out machine learning projects and deploy the model in production

Core

At least 2 years' proven experience in data analysis in the retail industry is preferred
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (i.e. Python and/or R)
Knowledge of basic machine learning, including but not limited to regression, decision tree, time series, boosting, deep learning, etc.
A Strong ability in writing Python and/or R code for machine learning projects
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
BS or MS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or related quantitative displace. Ph.D. is a plus.
Creative business thinking and open-minded. Ability to convert information into insights
Strong team player, adaptable and flexible to changes
Proactive, independent, responsible, creative and self-motivated
Strong interest in data science

Good to have

Retail industry experience
Supply chain knowledge
Passion for fashion
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience with Git, Linux and cloud service, e.g., AWS
title: (SENIOR) DATA SCIENTINST

description:
We act as architects of digital change, helping our clients create innovative and effective solutions. Our teams are always client-focused and multi-disciplinary with a focus on digital problem solving. This is an exceptionally diverse role where you have the chance to make a real contribution to our business.

The opportunit y

The UX researcher will design, lead and execute the strategic research and usability studies. Create actional insights from results, data and industry landscape for UX design. Build competency within the team and responsible for setting UX policy and standards and ensuring that those policies and standards are adhered to by the team.

Your key responsibilities

Demonstrate strong appreciation and knowledge of UX and fundamental design principles.
Independently set up research framework and cadence to ensure strong user understanding.
Good communication with project and delivery teams to ensure alignment.
Work alongside project consultants, creative designers and developers to ensure proposed designs and UX results in the best user experience and is technically feasible.

Design user flows and prototype experiences in an iterative manner with stakeholders.
Translate complex/broad user needs, style guides, and business requirements into simple yet elegant features ideas and world-class experiences.
Conducting UX reviews during the course of project process.
Facilitate and lead usability testing process.
Design and lead focus group / research to solve existing problems, validate hypothesis and designs, or explore and develop new business opportunities.

Build empathy and be a user advocate in our web development process.
Able to roll up sleeves and support in designing / project management when necessary
Assisting with pitches where required.
Coaching, supporting, energising, and ensuring best practices are instilled into the team.
Interpreting client briefs and establishing the appropriate approach.
Participate in key meetings to ensure a smooth delivery.
Preparing and running workshops.

Skills and attributes for success

Passionate about UX and design
Highly motivated with excellent problem-solving skills
Strong visual sense and a keen eye for design
Strong storytelling and communication skills
Able to balance the use of qualitative and quantitative data to guide project managers and designers
Strong analytics skill set
Excellent interpersonal and people skills - influencing internal team, engaging external focus groups and customers
Relentless desire for innovation, balanced with business needs and customer expectations
An entrepreneurial spirit with a self-starter attitude and ability to get your hands dirty
An insatiable desire for knowledge and a natural curiosity about the ‘hows’ and ‘whys’
Ability to lead and inspire other members of the UX team and able work with precision under tight deadlines.

To qualify for the role you must have

Bachelor’s Degree in in human-computer interaction, human factors engineering, industrial engineering, cognitive science, experimental psychology, anthropology, information sciences, related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with usability testing tools such as Tobii etc.

Experience with analysis and presentation tools such as Excel, PowerPoint etc.
Experience with design prototyping on tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision etc.
Experience with collaboration tools such as Mural etc.
Basic understanding of the domain expertise of partner teams such as web digital technologies, product and business stakeholders.
Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.
Strong working knowledge of statistics, survey design, interviewing, and the principles of experiment design.
Empathy for users and a drive to discover and resolve their pain points.
Passion for solving user problems and creating delightful design experiences.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with an ability to quickly command trust and respect from executives and partners

Ideally, you’ll also have

Maintaining UX knowledge by attending conferences, reading blogs and other news sources etc.
Disseminating knowledge within the business by writing website articles, conducting lunch and learns.

What we look for

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What working at EY offers

EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:

Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transactions, and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.
